Content.String: Indicates or executes a cold start (data initialized to default values)
Indicates there was a warm start with data backup
Time base of 10 ms generated by an internal clock
Time base of 100 ms generated by an internal clock
Time base of 1 s generated by an internal clock
Time base of 1 min generated by an internal clock
I/O communication is running correctly (1), I/O communication error detected (0)
Watchdog overflow causes the controller to change to HALT
The controller is running
Indicates the first controller cycle in RUN mode
This bit indicates there is at least one input or output forced
This bit indicates there is at least one input forced
This bit indicates there is at least one output forced
It indicates the value of the last ejected bit
It indicates an overflow when a 16 bit operation is performed
It indicates scan time greater than the period defined by the user
This bit indicates an index overflow of the indexed object address when a 16 bit operation is performed
At state 1, this bit causes GRAFCET initialization. Active steps are deactivated and initial steps are activated
At state 1, this bit causes the active steps of the entire GRAFCET to be deactivated
Set to 1, this bit validates the pre-positioning of GRAFCET. Maintaining this bit at 1 freezes the GRAFCET (freezes the chart)
This bit indicates if a new Ethernet configuration is changing
Set to 1 (if there is no post configuration in use), this bit allows to set new Ethernet configuration by %SW33 to %SW38
Set to 1, this bit allows to force some specific Ethernet configuration set in %S35 and %S36
This bit indicates Ethernet Duplex mode. Set to 0 if Half Duplex, Set to 1 if Full Duplex
This bit indicates Ethernet speed. Set to 0 if 10 Mbps, Set to 1 if 100 Mbps
This bit indicates if events are placed in the events queue as soon as they are detected
This bit indicates if there is a saturation of events queue
Set to 1, the automatic re-arming of outputs following a short circuit is enabled
Set to 1, this bit allows to update the date and time
Set to 1, the date and time must be initialized by the user
At state 1, the date and time must be initialized
Set to 1, the date and time are incremented or decremented according to the rising edges on the control bits set in %SW59
Disables the battery LED when set to 1
Set to 1, external battery power is low, or no external battery is detected
User sets this bit to 1 to erase all %MW variables in the flash memory
User set this bit to 1 to store the %MW variable in the flash (up to 1000)
Set to 1, the backup program is valid
Set to 1, the address can be changed by changing the values of %SW101 (port 1) or %SW102 (port 2)
Set to 1, this bit allows to configure ASCII protocol on Serial Line 1
Set to 1, this bit allows to configure ASCII protocol on Serial Line 2
This bit is set to 0 when an I/O communication interruption is detected on the base controller
Modifies controller scan period defined at configuration through the user program in the Animation Table Editor
Modifies the cycle time [5...255 ms] of the Periodic task
Modifies the cycle time [2...255 ms] of the Periodic task
Controller Status: NO CONFIG (0), STOP (2), RUN (3), HALT (4), POWERLESS MODE (5)
Contains the maximum value of the watchdog
Contains the boot version of the controller
Contains the commercial version of the controller
Contains the Firmware version of the controller (1st word)
Contains the Firmware version of the controller (2° word)
Contains the absolute timer counter (1st word)
Contains the absolute timer counter (2° word)
Shows execution time of the last controller scan cycle (in ms).If the scan time is 2,250 ms, %SW30 = 2 and %SW70 = 250
Shows execution time of the longest controller scan cycle since last cold start (in ms). If the scan time is 2,250 ms, %SW31 = 2 and %SW71 = 250
Shows execution time of shortest controller scan cycle since the last cold start (in ms). If the scan time is 2,250 ms, %SW32 = 2 and %SW72 = 250
Shows the average execution time of the periodic task in µs (last 5 times)
Shows how many events have been executed since the last cold start
RTC Function: contains in BCD xN Day of the week (N=1 for Monday)
RTC Function: contains in BCD 00SS Seconds
RTC Function: contains in BCD HHMM: hour and minute
RTC Function: contains in BCD MMDD: month and day
RTC Function: contains in BCD CCYY: century and year
Time of the last power failure or controller stop (in BCD): SS Seconds
Time of the last power failure or controller stop (in BCD): HHMM Hour and minute
Time of the last power failure or controller stop (in BCD): MMDD Month and day
Time of the last power failure or controller stop (in BCD): CCYY Century and year
Displays code giving cause of last stop: Run/Stop input edge,Stop at software detected fault, Stop command, Power outage,Stop at hardware detected fault
Contains two sets of 8 bits to adjust current date.The operation is always performed on rising edge of the bit. This word is enabled by bit %S59
Displays Ethernet controller hardware Id
Contains EXCH1 error code, see online help for details
Contains EXCH2 error code, see online help for details
Contains the logic controller code ID. For more information, refer to the M221 Logic Controller Code ID table
Shows the microseconds of the execution time of the last controller scan cycle. If the scan time is 2,250 ms the %SW30 will be 2 and the %SW70 = 250
Shows the microseconds of the execution time of the longest controller scan cycle since the last cold start. If the scan time is 2,250 ms the %SW31 will be 2 and the %SW71 = 250
Shows the microseconds of the execution time of shortest controller scan cycle since the last cold start. If the scan time is 2,250 ms the %SW32 will be 2 and the %SW72 = 250
Shows percentage of processing load
Down Counter 1, decremented individually by the system every ms
Down Counter 2, decremented individually by the system every ms
Down Counter 3, decremented individually by the system every ms
Down Counter 4, decremented individually by the system every ms
Each bit indicate status of the embedded analog inputs
Contains the signature, changes in case of an application change, in terms of configuration or programming data
Contains the signature, changes in case of an application change, in terms of configuration or programming data
Post configuration status of Serial Line 1. The bits are set to 1 when the post configuration was applied for the parameter
Post configuration status of Serial Line 2. The bits are set to 1 when the post configuration was applied for the parameter
Address of port 1, when bit %S101 is set to 1, you can change the Modbus address
Address of port 2, when bit %S101 is set to 1, you can change the Modbus address
Enables or disables operation of schedule blocks by the user program or operator display
Shows optional expansion module configuration (refer F1 help for details)
Shows the last execution time of the event input %I0.2 in µs
Shows the last execution time of the event input %I0.3 in µs
Shows the last execution time of the event input %I0.4 in µs
Shows the last execution time of the event input %I0.5 in µs
Shows the last execution time of the event Threshold 0 of HSC0 in µs
Shows the last execution time of the event Threshold 1 of HSC0 in µs
Shows the last execution time of the event Threshold 0 of HSC1 in µs
Shows the last execution time of the event Threshold 1 of HSC1 in µs
Shows the last execution time of the periodic task in µs
Shows the protection error status of output blocks
Number of persistent variables (maximum 1,000)
Shows the last execution time of the event input %I0.2 in ms
Shows the last execution time of the event input %I0.3 in ms
Shows the last execution time of the event input %I0.4 in ms
Shows the last execution time of the event input %I0.5 in ms
Shows the last execution time of the event threshold 0 of HSC0 in ms
Shows the last execution time of the event threshold 1 of HSC0 in ms
Shows the last execution time of the event threshold 0 of HSC1 in ms
Shows the last execution time of the event threshold 1 of HSC1 in ms
Shows the last execution time of the PERIODIC task in ms
Shows the average execution time (last 5 times) of the PERIODIC task in ms
Shows the average execution time (last 5 times) of event 0 in ms
Shows the average execution time (last 5 times) of event 1 in ms
Shows the average execution time (last 5 times) of event 2 in ms
Shows the average execution time (last 5 times) of event 3 in ms
Shows the average execution time (last 5 times) of event 4 in ms
Shows the average execution time (last 5 times) of event 5 in ms
Shows the average execution time (last 5 times) of event 6 in ms
Shows the average execution time (last 5 times) of event 7 in ms
Counts the number of frames transmitted by the Serial Line 1
Counts the number of frames transmitted by the Serial Line 2
Counts the number of frames transmitted by the USB channel
Counts the number of frames correctly received by the Serial Line 1
Counts the number of frames correctly received by the Serial Line 2
Counts the number of frames correctly received by the USB channel
Counts the number of frames received in error by the Serial Line 1
Counts the number of frames received in error by the Serial Line 2
Counts the number of frames received in error by the USB channel
Set to 1 to apply fallbacks on digital and analog outputs
User set this bit to 1 to store the %MW variable in the flash (up to 2000)
Default value is 0. Set to 1 changes the IO bus behavior by managing IO module exchanges even with a permanent error
The rising edge on this bit allows to reconfigure and restart the IO bus
Set to 1 to reset the IOScanner on Serial Line 1
Set to 1 to reset the IOScanner on Serial Line 2
Set to 1 to suspend the IOScanner on Serial Line 1
Set to 1 to suspend the IOScanner on Serial Line 2
Modifies the cycle time of the Periodic task
Contains the Firmware version of the controller (2nd word)
Contains the absolute timer counter (2nd word)
Number of persistent variables (maximum 2000)
Contains the IOScanner status of Serial Line 1
Contains the IOScanner status of Serial Line 2
Set to 1 if there is valid data saved on flash
User set this bit to 1 to restore the saved data
This word shows the state of the controller (refer F1 help for details)
Default status when an error is detected in a floating arithmetic operation (refer F1 help for details)
Shows the average execution time of the event 0 in us (last 5 times)
Shows the average execution time of the event 1 in us (last 5 times)
Shows the average execution time of the event 2 in us (last 5 times)
Shows the average execution time of the event 3 in us (last 5 times)
Shows the average execution time of the event 4 in us (last 5 times)
Shows the average execution time of the event 5 in us (last 5 times)
Shows the average execution time of the event 6 in us (last 5 times)
Shows the average execution time of the event 7 in us (last 5 times)
Contains the command and/or diagnostics for save/restore function of application program (refer F1 help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII protocol of port 1 when bit %S103 (refer F1 help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII protocol of port 2 when bit %S104 (refer F1 help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII protocol of port 1 when bit %S103 (refer F1 help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII protocol of port 2 when bit %S104 (refer F1 help for details)
Shows IO bus controller status (refer F1 help for details)
Shows expansion I/O module status (refer F1 help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII frame size of port 1 when bit %S103 (refer F1 help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII frame size of port 2 when bit %S104 (refer F1 help for details)
Shows the status code for the Cartridge 1 (refer F1 help for details)
Shows the status code for the Cartridge 2 (refer F1 help for details)
Set to 1, it indicates that there is an overflow in a memory object when managing strings
Backup/restore memory values to internal flash (0, default) or to SDcard (1)
Set this bit to 1 to erase all memory values in non-volatile memory
Set to 1 if there are valid memory values saved in non-volatile memory
Set this bit to 1 to backup the memory values to non-volatile memory (%S90 = 0) or SD card (%S90 = 1)
Set this bit to 1 to restore the memory values from non-volatile memory (%S90 = 0) or SDcard (%S90 = 1)
This word shows the state of the controller (see online help for details)
Default status when an error is detected in a floating arithmetic operation (see online help for details)
Shows the average execution time of the event 0 in µs (last 5 times)
Shows the average execution time of the event 1 in µs (last 5 times)

Shows the average execution time of the event 7 in µs (last 5 times)
Contains the command and/or diagnostics for save/restore function of application program (see online help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII protocol of port 1 when bit %S103 is set to 1 (see online help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII protocol of port 2 when bit %S104 is set to 1 (see online help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII protocol of port 1 when bit %S103 is set to 1 (see online help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII protocol of port 2 when bit %S104 is set to 1 (see online help for details)
Controller Serial number part 1 (BCD)
Controller Serial number part 2 (BCD)
Controller Serial number part 3 (BCD)
Shows IO bus controller status (see online help for details)
Indicates the expansion modules configured as optional (see online help for details)
Shows expansion I/O module status (see online help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII frame size of port 1 when bit %S103 is set to 1 (see online help for details)
Configuration for use of the ASCII frame size of port 2 when bit %S104 is set to 1 (see online help for details)
Shows the status code for the Cartridge 1 (see online help for details)
Shows the status code for the Cartridge 2 (see online help for details)
Controller last error code 1
Controller last error code 2
Controller last error code 3
Number of entries in PlcLog.csv
Provides status of the backup/restore to/from SD card operation
Number of memory values to backup/restore to/from non-volatile memory (%S90 = 0) or SD card (%S90 = 1)
Set to 1, this bit allows to initialize the modem, see also %SW167
Describes the answer of the modem to the last init command
Contains the version of the Remote Graphic Display
Remote Graphic Display connection state
Remote Graphic Display last error detected
The display will switch automatically to the alarm page
The Display backlight will be red as long as an alarm is active
Contains the Display page INDEX and allows to choose an other page
Shows the Ethernet error code (0 No error, 1 Duplicate IP, 2 DHCP in Progress, 3 BOOTP in Progress, 4 Invalid parameters, 5 Fixed IP in progress, 6 Ethernet com in Fail)
Contains EXCH3 error code for Ethernet controllers, see online help for details
Post configuration status of Ethernet port. The bits are set to 1 when the post configuration was applied for the parameter
Shows the number of Ethernet Modbus TCP server connections in use
Counts the number of frames transmitted by Modbus TCP on Ethernet
Counts the number of frames correctly received by Modbus TCP on Ethernet
Counts the number of frames received in error by Modbus TCP on Ethernet
For IP address AA.BB.CC.DD: %SW33 = CC.DD and %SW34 = AA.BB (1st word)
For IP address AA.BB.CC.DD: %SW33 = CC.DD and %SW34 = AA.BB (2° word)
For Sub-network mask AA.BB.CC.DD: %SW35 = CC.DD and %SW36 = AA.BB (1st word)
For Sub-network mask AA.BB.CC.DD: %SW35 = CC.DD and %SW36 = AA.BB (2° word)
For Gateway address AA.BB.CC.DD: %SW37 = CC.DD and %SW38 = AA.BB (1st word)
For Gateway address AA.BB.CC.DD: %SW37 = CC.DD and %SW38 = AA.BB (2° word)
For MAC address AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF %SW107 = AA:BB (1st word)
For MAC address AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF %SW108 = CC:DD (2° word)
For MAC address AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF %SW108 = EE:FF (3° word)
Contains 2nd part CC.DD of IP address AA.BB.CC.DD
Contains 1st part AA.BB of IP address AA.BB.CC.DD
Contains 2nd part CC.DD of sub-network mask AA.BB.CC.DD
Contains 1st part AA.BB of sub-network mask AA.BB.CC.DD
Contains 2nd part CC.DD of Gateway address AA.BB.CC.DD
Contains 1st part AA.BB of Gateway address AA.BB.CC.DD
Contains 1st part AA.BB of MAC address AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF
Contains 2nd part CC.DD of MAC address AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF
Contains 3rd part EE.FF of MAC address AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF
Set to 1 to reset the IOScanner on Ethernet
Set to 1 to suspend the IOScanner on Ethernet
Contains the IOScanner status on Ethernet
Counts the number of frames transmitted by the Modbus mapping table
Counts the number of frames correctly received by the Modbus mapping table
Reads the input Assembly Instance Number
Reads the input Assembly Instance Size
Reads the output Assembly Instance Number
Reads the output Assembly Instance Size
Counts the number of frames transmitted on Ethernet IP (1st word)
Counts the number of frames transmitted on Ethernet IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of frames received on Ethernet IP (1st word)
Counts the number of frames received on Ethernet IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of unconnected messages received on Ethernet IP (1st word)
Counts the number of unconnected messages received on Ethernet IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of invalid unconnected messages received on Ethernet IP (1st word)
Counts the number of invalid unconnected messages received on Ethernet IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of class 3 requests received on Ethernet IP (1st word)
Counts the number of class 3 requests received on Ethernet IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of invalid class 3 requests received on Ethernet IP (1st word)
Counts the number of invalid class 3 requests received on Ethernet IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of connection timeouts on Ethernet IP
Reads the Ethernet IP flag from last I/O packet: Idle (value=0), Run (value=1), Error (value=2)
Counts the number of frames transmitted on EtherNet/IP (1st word)
Counts the number of frames transmitted on EtherNet/IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of frames received on EtherNet/IP (1st word)
Counts the number of frames received on EtherNet/IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of unconnected messages received on EtherNet/IP (1st word)
Counts the number of unconnected messages received on EtherNet/IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of invalid unconnected messages received on EtherNet/IP (1st word)
Counts the number of invalid unconnected messages received on EtherNet/IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of class 3 requests received on EtherNet/IP (1st word)
Counts the number of class 3 requests received on EtherNet/IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of invalid class 3 requests received on EtherNet/IP (1st word)
Counts the number of invalid class 3 requests received on EtherNet/IP (2nd word)
Counts the number of connection timeouts on EtherNet/IP
Reads the EtherNet/IP flag from last I/O packet: Idle (value=0), Run (value=1), Error (value=2)
Set to 1, the address can be changed by changing the values of %SW101 (port 1) or %SW102 (port 2) or %SW111 (port 5)
Ρύθμιση στο 1, ενεργοποιεί την επαναφορά της συσκευής με χρήση αντικειμένου ταυτότητας CIP στο πρωτόκολλο Ethernet/IP
